title: Understanding the role of product ops | Christine Itwaru (Pendo)
key_insights: Product ops is both a system/process and a role - companies can implement product ops practices without necessarily hiring dedicated people
The main value of product ops is giving PMs back quality time with customers by handling internal alignment and stakeholder management
Product ops emerged as a natural evolution when product teams scaled and CPOs took on broader business responsibilities beyond just product delivery
Successful product ops professionals should focus on automating processes and moving to more strategic work rather than maintaining manual tasks long-term
The quality of questions product teams receive from sales/success teams is a key indicator of whether you need product ops support
Product ops differs from product marketing by focusing on internal education and understanding rather than positioning and selling
Engineers participating in customer meetings can dramatically improve product development decisions and team confidence
Most successful product ops leaders come from product management backgrounds, while individual contributors often come from consulting, customer success, or technical roles
topics_discussed: Definition and evolution of product operations role
Product ops vs product management responsibilities

memorable_quotes: Speaking as a former PM, I would not ever give up spending time with customers and watching their pain. That's how I fell in love with product.
Do you want your PMs to constantly be fielding questions from your revenue team when they could be spending time with customers?
We as product ops want to and should be standing up whatever processes or systems are needed and then get out of the way so we can focus on driving more strategic value.
recommended_for: Product leaders evaluating team structure needs
Professionals interested in product operations roles
Companies experiencing scaling challenges with product teams
Cross-functional leaders seeking better alignment strategies
summary: Christine Itwaru provides a comprehensive guide to product operations, explaining how the role emerged to help product managers focus on customers while handling internal alignment and processes. She offers practical advice on when companies need product ops, career transition paths, and how to implement effective systems for cross-functional collaboration.
